abstract: And do its policies favor banks over merchants and consumers?
snippet: And do its policies favor banks over merchants and consumers?
lead_paragraph: We just published an article by Andrew Martin that explains how Visa has become the dominant payment network for credit and debit cards. Among other things, the article reports that Visa makes more than twice as much money on a transaction if a consumer signs a debit receipt rather than punching in a four-digit PIN. Mr. Martin also writes:
